intro: Bouvardia scabra, commonly known as the rough bouvardia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It is often cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care. Bouvardia scabra prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
